com.github.jhanne82.documenttree.document

Class Document<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jhanne82.documenttree.document.Document<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the elements of terms describing the document.

    public class Document<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic representation of a document. A document will be defined by a term vector which describes the document and a name.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Document(T[] termVector, java.lang.String documentName)
      Constructs a Document object with a defined list of terms and a document name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRelevance(double relevance)
      Appends the latest calculated relevance to the FIFO buffer containing the relevances.
      void clearRelevanceBuffer()
      Clears the FIFO buffer which contains the latest calculated relevance values.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.
      double getAverageRelevance()
      Returns the average of all relevance values store in the FIFO buffer.
      int getCountOfStoredRelevances()
      Returns the current size of the ring buffer containing the calculated relevance from the last searches.
      java.lang.String getDocumentName()
      Returns the stored name of the document.
      double getLatestCalculatedRelevance()
      Returns the latest relevance value.
      T[] getTermVector()
      Retuns an array which is the presentation of the term vector describing the document.
      int getTimestampOfLatestSearch()
      Returns the timestamp of the latest search on this document.
      void setTimestampOfLatestSearch(int timestampOfLatestSearch)
      Sets the timestamp of the latest search on this document.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Document

        public Document(T[] termVector,
                java.lang.String documentName)
        Constructs a Document object with a defined list of terms and a document name. The size of the relevance buffer is fix with 20.
        Parameters:
        termVector - defines the elements of the term which describes the document.
        documentName - defines the name of the document.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimestampOfLatestSearch

        public void setTimestampOfLatestSearch(int timestampOfLatestSearch)
        Sets the timestamp of the latest search on this document.
        Parameters:
        timestampOfLatestSearch - defines the timestamp

      • getTimestampOfLatestSearch

        public int getTimestampOfLatestSearch()
        Returns the timestamp of the latest search on this document.
        Returns:
        timestamp of the latest search

      • getTermVector

        public T[] getTermVector()
        Retuns an array which is the presentation of the term vector describing the document.
        Returns:
        the term vector as array

      • getDocumentName

        public java.lang.String getDocumentName()
        Returns the stored name of the document.
        Returns:
        the document name

      • getAverageRelevance

        public double getAverageRelevance()
        Returns the average of all relevance values store in the FIFO buffer.
        Returns:
        the average value over all relevance values

      • getLatestCalculatedRelevance

        public double getLatestCalculatedRelevance()
        Returns the latest relevance value.
        Returns:
        the latest relevance which was added to the FIFO buffer.

      • addRelevance

        public void addRelevance(double relevance)
        Appends the latest calculated relevance to the FIFO buffer containing the relevances.
        Parameters:
        relevance - value to be appended to the FIFO buffer

      • clearRelevanceBuffer

        public void clearRelevanceBuffer()
        Clears the FIFO buffer which contains the latest calculated relevance values.

      • getCountOfStoredRelevances

        public int getCountOfStoredRelevances()
        Returns the current size of the ring buffer containing the calculated relevance from the last searches. The size represents the number of past searches for which a relevance was calculated after the document was repositioned.
        Returns:
        the size of the relevance buffer

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. Equal means for the Document object that the document names are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the reference object with which to compare.
        Returns:
        true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
